title: WCAS PSYCH 314-0-26 Special Topics in Psychology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Evolutionary psychology is the study of how genetic and cultural evolution have influenced our psychology and behavior. General domains of interest include mating, aggression, cooperation, and morality. The course will include both didactic lectures and student discussions (and perhaps presentations).

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evaluation will consist of two exams (a midterm and a second exam on the last day of class).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: There is no textbook for the class. Readings will be provided by the instructor.

subject: PSYCH
